subject: AW: Loadcell Breakpedal
description_text:
Hello,

the loadcell cann you help me with that?

Regards
Stefan Zander
________________________________
From: Stefan Zander <stefan.zander@gmx.net>
Sent: Thursday, May 8, 2025 5:44 PM
To: General sales enquiries and <service@simsonn.com>
Subject: Re: Loadcell Breakpedal

Hello,

here is the order.
[image0.png]
Mit freundlichen Grüßen

Am 08.05.2025 um 08:25 schrieb General and sales enquiries <service@simsonn.com>:

﻿
Hello, can you help with the order number?

________________________________
service@simsonn.com

From: stefan.zander@gmx.net<mailto:stefan.zander@gmx.net>
Date: 2025-05-07 18:42
To: service@simsonn.com<mailto:service@simsonn.com>
Subject: Loadcell Breakpedal

Hello,


Now I have a different problem. The brake load cell only goes up to about 14100 in Simsonn Manager. I can press the pedal as hard as I want, but it doesn't go any higher. It feels like it's about 60-80 kg at most.


What could be causing this? Is it possible that the Loadcell is already defective?

Viele Grüße
Stefan

conversations.body_text: Hi stefan. zander@gmx. net,  ​Are you currently using the red damper? Have you tried switching to the yellow or blue damper? Different colors of dampers are designed for different force levels. The red damper cannot handle up to 140kg of force during heavy braking, and excessive deformation may cause damage.

Hello, please see the picture. This is my configuration. Mit freundlichen Grüßen Stefan Am 12.09.2025 um 06:23 schrieb service@simsonn.com: ﻿ 
 
 Hi stefan. zander@gmx. net, Are you currently using the red damper? Have you tried switching to the yellow or blue damper? Different colors of dampers are designed for different force levels. The red damper cannot handle up to 140kg of force during heavy braking, and excessive deformation may cause damage. 
 
 
 
 
 On
 Thu, 11 Sep at 11:28 AM
 , stefan. zander@gmx. net <stefan.zander@gmx.net> wrote:
 
Hello, 
 
 
 
 
the loadcell cann you help me with that? 
 
 
 
 
Regards 
 
Stefan Zander

Hi stefan. zander@gmx. net,    The colors cannot be mixed — you must use only one color of damper at a time. Mixing different colors can cause uneven force distribution during heavy braking, which may result in damage to the red and yellow dampers.  Additionally, please provide a video showing the force display while pressing the pedal, so we can better analyze the issue.

Hi,

Here is a Link to a video.
Here you can see that the pressure does not increase any further, even though I continue to press the pedal.

Stefan

Hi stefan. zander@gmx. net,     Please check the sensor actuation screw position:    If it’s too low, that’s incorrect; it should sit near the top at rest. During pressing, the sensor should move downward.    When the default position is too low, it won’t preload the sensor, so no pressure is applied.    Adjustment:    Locate the center set screw on the bottom of the pedal sensor.    Using an M6 wrench (hex key), turn it clockwise to raise the screw so the rest position moves up.    Make small incremental adjustments (e.g., ¼ turn each time) and test after each change until the sensor loads properly when pressing.    After adjustment, re-test / recalibrate in the software.

Hello, I can't adjust the screw marked in the picture; it's fixed and only serves as a bolt.

Mit freundlichen Grüßen
Stefan

I have the upgrade kit from Pro x to Pro x Ultra, in case that note is of any use. There may be differences from the original Pro X Ultra.

Hi stefan. zander@gmx. net,     First, try adjusting this screw and check whether the side screw has reached its limit.    If the issue persists, remove the protective cover at the bottom of the brake, then raise the front section of the pedal by one level so that the sensor is positioned further away from the base.
